summary:
## African Union: A Union of African Countries

The African Union (AU) is a group of 55 African countries working together. It was started in 2002 to replace the older Organisation of African Unity. The AU makes important decisions at meetings of African leaders. Its main office is in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

The AU aims to improve life in Africa by promoting peace, trade, and cooperation between its member states. It has its own parliament and security council. In 2023, the AU became a member of the G20, a group of the world's largest economies.
title: African Union
